definitions.definition: The desire to purchase goods and services.
definitions.example: Prices usually go up when demand exceeds supply.

definitions.definition: The amount of a good or service that consumers are willing to buy at a particular price.

definitions.example: Modern society is responding to women's demands for equality.
His job makes many demands on his time.
She couldn't ignore the newborn baby's demands for attention.

definitions.definition: (electricity supply) More precisely peak demand or peak load, a measure of the maximum power load of a utility's customer over a short period of time; the power load integrated over a specified time interval.

definitions.example: I demand to see the manager.

definitions.definition: To claim a right to something.
definitions.example: The bank is demanding the mortgage payment.
This job demands a lot of patience.

definitions.definition: To issue a summons to court.
